security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill with scoped git operations. The skill defines a workflow using Claude's built-in tools for reading git state and repository files. All capabilities are directly related to PR generation purpose.

low_findings.title: Environment variable access for JIRA ticket
low_findings.description: The skill reads the JIRA_TICKET environment variable (lines 41-43) to insert ticket identifiers into PR templates. While this is expected behavior for a PR tool, it demonstrates that the skill can access environment variables. An attacker could theoretically set JIRA_TICKET to a malicious value, but since this skill is prompt-based and runs within Claude's sandbox, the impact is contained.

content.user_title: Create pull request content from git changes
content.value_statement: Creating pull request descriptions takes time and often leads to incomplete documentation. This skill generates commit messages, PR titles, and PR bodies automatically by analyzing your git changes against the default branch.
actual_capabilities: Generates commit messages (max 80 characters) from staged and committed changes
Creates PR titles that summarize the overall purpose of the changes
Fills PR body templates with summary, key changes, and checklist items
Reads JIRA ticket identifiers from environment variables
Preserves all checkbox items from PR templates while marking applicable items
limitations: Requires git repository with uncommitted or staged changes
Does not modify files or push to remote repositories
Cannot create branches or open PRs on GitHub directly
Relies on existing PR template (.github/pull_request_template.md) for body structure

use_cases.title: Streamline PR documentation
use_cases.description: Automatically generate complete PR descriptions instead of writing them manually for every merge request

use_cases.title: Enforce PR template compliance
use_cases.description: Ensure all contributors provide consistent, complete PR information using existing templates

use_cases.title: Improve change visibility
use_cases.description: Get clear summaries of what changed and why, making reviews faster and more thorough

prompt_templates.title: With JIRA integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create PR content and include the JIRA ticket identifier in the description

output_examples.input: Generate PR content for my current changes
output: COMMIT MESSAGE: Add user authentication module with OAuth support
PR TITLE: Add user authentication module with OAuth support
This PR implements a complete user authentication system supporting both traditional email/password and OAuth providers.
- Added User model with email, password hash, and OAuth fields
- Implemented JWT token generation and validation
- Created OAuth login handlers for GitHub and Google
- Added authentication middleware for protected routes
- Wrote unit tests for core authentication functions

best_practices: Run the skill after staging or committing changes for accurate diff analysis
Review and edit generated content before finalizing
Use with existing PR templates for consistent documentation across your team
anti_patterns: Using without any git changes (no diff to analyze)
Expecting the skill to push branches or open PRs on remote servers
Skipping template review when PR template has project-specific requirements

faq.question: Does this skill push to GitHub?
faq.answer: No. The skill only generates PR content. You must manually push your branch and open the PR.

faq.question: Which git commands does it run?
faq.answer: It uses git diff, git rev-parse, git status, git symbolic-ref, and git diff --cached to analyze changes.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All git analysis happens locally. The skill only reads repository state to generate descriptions.

faq.question: What if I have no PR template?
faq.answer: The skill generates a default PR body with Summary, Key changes, and Types of changes sections.

faq.question: Can it handle merge conflicts?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes your local changes. You must resolve conflicts manually before using it.

faq.question: How is this different from commitizen?
faq.answer: This skill generates both commit messages AND full PR descriptions. Commitizen only handles commit messages.
